2062440.name: Course Correction
2062440.description:
Pilot an aging, unreliable spacecraft around the asteroid Ceres, in this realistic space flight simulator. Featuring extremely detailed systems modelling, simply surviving a flight will require detailed knowledge of your spacecraft, its systems and the emergency procedures. Switches, buttons, levers, checklists, procedures, and with full VR and HOTAS/HOSAS support guarantee a hands-on interactive cockpit experience like no other.

  • Features • Detailed flight dynamics – Pilot the most accurately modeled spaceship out there. Trajectories must be estimated and refined by the pilot; no magic numbers or automatic guidance are provided. Every maneuver requires attention and careful adjustment.

  • Thrusters and propulsion – Engines and thrusters produce slightly varying forces, with minor instabilities, shifting center of gravity, fuel slosh, off-axis thrusts, and uneven output, making handling a precise, and skillful challenge.

  • Extensive spacecraft systems – Power, life support, communications, propulsion, and avionics all interact realistically, degrade over time, and can fail unexpectedly.

  • Advanced radio simulation – Every antenna, transmitter, and receiver is modeled with physical accuracy. Signals vary with orientation, distance, terrain, and interference.

  • Traffic control – Receive guidance and clearances from traffic control, while struggling with signal delays, dropouts, and intermittent transmissions.

  • Cabin and life support systems – The breathable air in the cabin, including N2, O2 and CO2 levels, is fully simulated, including multiple pressurized tanks, valves, regulators, relief vents and suit loop simulation - and the consequences, should the mix go wrong.

  • Thermal and power management – Heat generation, dissipation, and energy distribution all influence performance and survival.

  • Aging systems and malfunctions – Components degrade with time and use; valves freeze and stick, battery voltages sag, gasses leak, and failures occur unpredictably. Survival depends on problem-solving, and knowing the systems and backup procedures.

  • Environmental and orbital modeling – Detailed orbital mechanics subtly affect flight, adding challenge to navigation and landings.

  • VR – Designed and built for an unparalleled VR experience from the ground up. Also supports flatscreen play.
